programmes.show_description: Jimmy Carr hosts as Sean Lock and Isy Suttie take on Jon Richardson and Richard Osman. Alex Horne and The Horne Section join Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Rachel Riley.
Jimmy Carr and team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by guests Gok Wan, Sarah Millican, Seann Walsh and Amy Childs from The Only Way Is Essex.
Greg Davies challenges five funny people to entertain him by completing baffling challenges. This time: Christmas crackers and eye-opening techniques.
Teleshopping
Teleshopping
Mike Roper, the president and CEO of quick-service Tex-Mex restaurant chain Taco Bueno, disguises himself to work among his staff and gain insight before growing the business.
John Carona, CEO of property management company Associa, goes undercover in his own organisation to see first-hand how his employees are dealing with recent changes at the firm.
In Yorkshire, there's plenty of banter, a Sheffield dessert and a saxophone-accompanied rap that leaves everyone speechless, as three couples put their hosting skills to the test.
In Nottingham, there's belching, balloon bursting, gargling games and 'slimy' food, as three couples put their hosting skills to the test.
...Selling: Chip and Danielle are overcrowded with a big dog, a toddler and a baby. So as Jonathan gets to work, Drew finds a perfect property. Will it be the couple's pup of tea?
The One with the Wedding Casino: The last thing Linda wants is anything tacky, garish or themed. Groom James didn't get the memo, and has got a Las Vegas-inspired reception up his sleeve.
The Medieval One: Stephen's always imagined his wedding would be a grand, medieval affair. So that's exactly what he's planned for his bride-to-be Shelley, who just wants something normal.
Three-time Olympic gold medallist Gabby Douglas goes undercover to meet up-and-coming gymnasts and inspirational coaches and help make their dreams come true.
Tony-winning Broadway star Idina Menzel disguises herself to go undercover and help unknown musical talents and performers who aspire to make it to the big stage.
La Galleria 33 (Part 1/2): Gordon tries to help La Galleria 33, run by sisters Rita and Lisa, who blame the restaurant's failures on everything from tablecloths to the weather.
La Galleria 33 (Part 2/2): The saga of Boston eatery La Galleria 33 comes to a dramatic conclusion as Gordon Ramsay gives restaurant owners and sisters Rita and Lisa an ultimatum.
...and Selling: Brand new series: The brothers help widow Alisha and her young son with a 10-day makeover and Drew helps her come to terms with this bittersweet new beginning.
Clash and Burn: To turn the charter around, Captain Glenn takes the guests on an epic sail. Lucy makes a grave mistake with a charter guest's garment.
Greg Davies deals out withering looks and occasional faint praise in his role as the Taskmaster. Ever wondered what was underneath Phil Wang's costume?
Jimmy Carr hosts as Jon Richardson and Alex Brooker take on Johnny Vegas and Sara Pascoe. Tom Allen joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Claudia Winkleman and Rob Beckett.
Mr Morris: The boys are excited that Grandma is coming to dinner, but she's bringing her new 82-year-old boyfriend Mr Morris. What could possibly go wrong?
The Loft: Adam isn't happy when Jonny claims to have dislocated his shoulder to get out of cleaning the loft. Mum and Dad aren't speaking, and Aunty Val visits to support Mum.
Attractive single white Guy seeks accommodation, and a new member of staff upsets the apple cart (or whatever they use to transport patients these days).
Jimmy Carr hosts as Jon Richardson and Alex Brooker take on Johnny Vegas and Sara Pascoe. Tom Allen joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Claudia Winkleman and Rob Beckett.
Jimmy Carr and team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by guests Patsy Kensit, Sarah Millican, Bear Grylls and Chris Ramsey for an extended version of the show.
Greg Davies deals out withering looks and occasional faint praise in his role as the Taskmaster. Ever wondered what was underneath Phil Wang's costume?
Teleshopping
Teleshopping
Country music artist Darius Rucker goes undercover at an open mic night, as a roadie and a busker, in a bid to find fresh songwriting and performing talent.
Restaurateur Marcus Samuelsson dons a disguise to work incognito in a teaching kitchen, a food truck and a culinary institute, searching for undiscovered chefs to mentor.
In Cardiff, first-timers Abi and Jake plan an American menu, while vegans Ashleigh and Jack serve plant-based fare. But can seasoned hosts Karen and James show the youngsters how it's done?
In the West Country, there are disastrous dishes and a peculiar pantomime performance, as handyman Sam and his wife Kate take on festival fans Aron and Kath, and farmers Kate and Colin.
...Selling: Jack and Clifton's home is filled with toddler toys and terrible interiors. As the brothers start work, they soon discover what lurks behind the 90-year-old walls.
The Brazilian Carnival One: Groom Eduardo plans a Brazilian carnival float with a huge inflatable horse, but princess bride Paulina yearns for posh nuptials in a castle...
The One on a Football Pitch: Tracey dreams of taking centre stage with a grand wedding ceremony at the Olympia Theatre, Dublin, but Peter's ideal place is the football field.
Sports bar chain Walk-On's founder, Brandon Landry, and co-owner, NFL quarterback Drew Brees, go undercover in their company to find out what life is like for their 4000 staff.
Chairman Alan McKim goes undercover in Clean Harbors, a hazardous waste disposal company that deals with anything from oil spills to hurricanes, to better understand his trade.
Mama Maria's: Gordon Ramsay visits Mama Maria's, a failing restaurant in Brooklyn, New York, where owner John is overwhelmed by running a business that's become stuck in the past.
Ms Jean's Southern Cuisine: Gordon's in Pennsylvania to help rescue a soul food restaurant that was opened 12 years ago by a retired special education teacher.
...and Selling: Brand new series: Lazarus and Evonna's dream house quickly turned into a renovation and financial nightmare. Can the brothers restore their faith in real estate?
Smoke on the Water: A new engine issue forces Captain Glenn to modify the plan and keep the returning guests entertained. Chase plans a night of drunk Twister.
It's the penultimate episode of the series. Rhod Gilbert's at the centre of satsuma-based controversy.
Jimmy Carr hosts as Sean Lock and Kevin Bridges take on Jon Richardson and Rebecca Front. Joe Lycett joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With maths whizz Rachel Riley.
The New Car: Jim makes a cake for his dog Wilson's birthday. The family return from a spin in Jonny's new but uncool company car to find something bad has happened to the house.
The Yoghurts: Jonny wants to split up with his 43-year-old girlfriend and boss, Liz, but is too scared. Grandma offers him advice, while Adam is happy to tease him about it.
Dr Statham enters politics; at least the manifesto will be grammatically correct. Caroline thinks her choice of lodger might be a mistake, but finds she has to live with it.
